question: What efforts are being made in the digital transition?
answer: In our ongoing effort to reduce our environmental impact, we have made significant strides in transitioning from print to digital. By encouraging our readers to opt for digital subscriptions, we are able to save thousands of trees each year. Our digital editions offer the same high-quality journalism you expect, with the added benefit of being eco-friendly. This shift not only helps conserve natural resources but also reduces the carbon footprint associated with the production and distribution of print newspapers.

question: What measures are taken for eco-friendly printing?
answer: For those who still enjoy the tactile experience of a print newspaper, we are committed to ensuring that our print editions are produced in the most environmentally responsible manner possible. We use 100% recycled paper, significantly reducing the need for virgin paper production and conserving forests. Our inks are soy-based, which are not only derived from renewable resources but also produce less volatile organic compounds (VOCs), making them less harmful to the environment. Our printing process adheres to the highest environmental standards, minimizing waste and energy consumption.

question: What sustainable operations are implemented in the office?
answer: Our commitment to sustainability extends beyond our publications. We have implemented a range of eco-friendly practices in our offices to reduce our environmental footprint. Our offices are equipped with energy-efficient lighting and appliances, significantly lowering our energy consumption. We have robust recycling programs in place, ensuring that paper, plastic, and electronic waste are properly recycled. Additionally, we have taken measures to reduce waste by promoting a paperless work environment and encouraging staff to use reusable containers and utensils. Our efforts in sustainable operations demonstrate our dedication to preserving the environment and promoting a culture of sustainability within our organization.
